They are comfortable to wear for long durations and I accidentally dropped one in the toilet and they are still perfect. So if you had any doubts before, let this be your sign. Buy these.

They won't die. I like to get new earphones/buds, charge them up, and see how long they last. So far, I've worn them for probably close to 20 hours, and they haven't indicated they are running out of juice. They are noise-reducing. They fit well, but I'm glad there are extra sizes for the covers because the default ones are a little tight for me. Anker has never let me down, and this was worth the try to get away from expensive AirPods that die every 2-3 years with a charge that doesn't last past 5 hours.

very good overall with fitting issues i bought these mainly to use for phone calls. they connect pretty quickly to my phone and keep connection well. voice is clear and sufficiently loud. people can hear me clearly while i'm inside, whereas when i'm outside sometimes background noise gets in the way, making conversation annoying. they sound pretty good for music. a little too boomy for my taste though. my main issue is the fit. the bulge behind the tip gets in the way, and i often find myself adjusting to keep them from falling out of my ear while i'm walking.

Great value and sound for $20, there's really nothing to complain about. These earbuds offer amazing sound quality. As someone that would consider themselves a basshead, the bass is definitely fulfilling. The box comes with a USB-C cable and 2 other pairs of different size eartips. They also provide an app that has several EQ presets and a pretty neat finding mode that allows you to find missing earbud(s) by making a chirping sound. A few things that would make these earbuds perfect is having an even smaller size eartip pair. I notice that they can slip away in my ears. Also, maybe a noise-canceling/transparency mode would be a plus. But nonetheless, for $20, you are getting a pretty good bargain.

Quality earbuds with great sound and a long-lasting battery. I found the quality of the sound from these wireless earbuds to be quite exceptional. In tests done by others, they compare favorably or even exceed the listener's expectations of popularly named (and very expensive) alternatives. Fit is very good, sound quality excellent, battery runtime on a charge outstanding. My only disappointment would be the manual that came with the earbuds was next to impossible to read by this senior's eyes. I had to download the .pdf version so I could view it at a comfortable size. No one should ever have to read a product manual or quick start guide with a magnifying glass. Also, online chat on the manufacturer's website which should have been available, was not. Otherwise, these earbuds would make a great gift for yourself, loved one, or friend.

Incredible! These sound phenomenal! The magnetic connector that helps them into the provided case is strong and definitely helps putting them back in. I also love that it has a wrist strap attached to it. These stay put in my ears perfectly and do come with a couple of other sizes to get the proper fit. I have a pair of Apple AirPods with spatial audio and these sound a lot better! For $20, you can't go wrong. I'll probably never buy another AirPod product again after having these actually. They get great battery life and stay in during workouts as well. I also like that there are color options.

Amazing wireless earbuds for the money!!! As I'm a luddite, I've always used the quite lousy wired Apple earphones that come with my various iPhones. They don't stay in my ears, the sound quality is crappy‚Äîso on Prime Day I decided to try these Anker P20i wireless earbuds. They are a total game changer! You must first download the app to get them to connect, but once you do it's absolutely seamless. They connect the moment you take them out of the small, very well-designed charging case, and great sound quality. For the very modest money, I can't imagine a better Bluetooth earbud. A great product with great value!! (And I like the dark blue color I got them in.)

they're good enough at this price point, I didn't plan on being too picky. I'm not super into audio quality. I just wanted them to be loud enough and sound alright. Well, these fit the bill. No crazy bass, but I can hear everything clearly and they sound fine. They pair to my phone easily, and the battery lasts me a long time. I couldn't keep track of how to control the touch controls, and I lost the booklet, so I just control on my phone. The couple of times I tried when they were new, the controls seemed to work fine. My only complaint is that they don't stay in my ears too well. I switch sizes of the plugs, and I think they might be a tad too heavy to stay in my ear. If I'm not moving much, they stay fine. Overall, I would recommend these for the price they cost. I like them despite having to adjust them sometimes.

$20 earbuds sound as good as AirPods with better battery life. I liked my Apple AirPods but the battery life was not great and they finally became unusable. I was not going to spend another $125-$150 for a new pair. After looking around Amazon and reading reviews, I decided to try the Soundcore P20i earbuds. I mostly use them for phone calls. The sound quality is as good as the Apple AirPods and these have much better battery life. For $20, you can't beat them. Bluetooth connection is very good. The only thing I would like is a slightly better fit but that may just be my ears. They do come with a few different size ear tips, so you should find ones that fit well. The case charges via a USB-C cable and one is included. I've done 2-hour phone calls with them. My AirPods would die after one hour. Easy connection to my smartphone and if you download the app, you can customize the sound. I highly recommend them. For $20, you can't go wrong.

These are badass! I ordered a pair of these to try them out and was more than blown away. With the app that pairs with them, you have unlimited white noise features as well as being able to customize the sound of these. The battery lasts forever, and the 10 mm driver throws bass like crazy! I ordered a second set just in case something happened to my first ones lol... I would give these 6 stars if they would let me!

Best cheap earbuds ever! I first bought these as a kind of \whatever, they are cheap, why not\ type of deal, and they ended up outperforming almost every other earbud I have ever had. For the price, I would say you cannot get a better set of earbuds that don't do all of the fancy stuff. It even does a few of the little fancy things if you download the app and control it. The case seems very durable, and I have dropped it a few times already. Overall, these definitely performed way over my expectations and have a great battery life. The volume is very good, easy to control, and the sound is very high quality.

Better than my Samsung earbuds, these earbuds are honestly amazing. The sound quality, fit, and battery life are 10 times better than my Samsung earbuds. I have had them for almost a month and only charged them when I first got them. I use them every night and sometimes during the day, and every time I put them in, I have 100% charge. Crazy! My Samsung would die by the morning. These are really a great value for the price!

My favorite brand! I love this brand for earbuds! I bought it in blue because that's my favorite color. The mic is good and it only needs to be charged like once a week maybe so charging isn't an issue. No issues with connectivity. These suckas are durable. I say that because I own first-gen earbuds and I accidentally washed them and they still work! Get them! You won't be disappointed üòå

Great sound and battery life, especially for the price. These sound great, have really good battery life, pair very easily, and have a great app. The only reason I don't rate them 5 stars is the app's lack of an ability to set a custom EQ. This problem is offset by the app having a wide array of EQ presets so most likely you can find one that works for you.

Great value but no software indication that active noise canceling is on. No sound pass-through when wearing but not doing any audio (music/call), so it acts as an earplug blocking hearing in that ear. No secondary retention, so if earplug is dislodged to hear by it, it‚Äôs at risk of falling out. No EQ function if using one alone. Case is a bit large and also gets scuffed easily, no small carabiner to hook to a belt loop. Otherwise, the sound quality is good, but I don‚Äôt know how it sounds to others via calls.

out of the box, impressed ... at least at this price point. i had doubts. i was replacing my beloved Liberty 2 Pro buds (an encounter with the washing machine ended them), and i didn't have the same budget. The P20i buds are definitely cheaper-feeling plastic, lighter weight, and the case feels cheaper. I saw that they had customizable EQ and I confused that with the HearID, which they do not have. That said, I have auditory processing disorder (APD/CAPD), so clarity is a really big deal for me, and that's something I'm definitely getting out of these earbuds right now. I wish I could raise the bass a little regardless of EQ setting, but that's not going to be a thing. It's just the choice of presets. The acoustic, surprisingly, is the most balanced. That hasn't been the case with a lot of preset EQs I've tried in the past 20 years. So far I've tried them on classical, heavy metal, power metal, classic pop rock and soft rock, 2000s alternative, modern and classic EDM, and classic Broadway. They get the job done nicely. Nothing sounds lost or muddled, at least on the acoustic setting. I just wish they had adjustable treble and bass. I mean really. This is a super basic feature to offer. You don't need the fancy HearID for basic EQ sliders. The sound is so close. A tiny tweak and it would be perfect. That said, I've bought earbuds at this price point that were destined for the trash, so these are quite nice for what they are. I don't like the touch buttons. I like tactile buttons. Especially on a thing that's in my ears and I can't actually see. But they're adjustable in the same Soundcore app I used for my Liberty 2 Pros, so that's a plus. At least I can set them to do what I want them to instead of having to learn a new system every time I buy a pair of buds. I can't speak to the noise-canceling ability until I try them at work. I work in a blue-collar environment with loud machinery (PSA: never, never, never, never use earbuds while working around heavy machinery, that's just dangerous. You have to be able to hear your coworkers and machine cues so you can react immediately when something goes wrong. Please stop. Thanks.). The persistent mechanical din cuts into break areas, which are small and also noisy with people and other sounds, and it can be hard for me to really unwind on my breaks. I have other neurodivergencies, so this is a pretty big deal. Some days I can tune it out, and some days it's a sensory nightmare I can't escape from for 12 hours. I will update when I've had the chance to test these earbuds in this setting. While writing this review, I've noticed that the P20is tend to either be too loud or too soft on certain tracks, especially rock. This isn't bothering me on Pearl Jam, but Disturbed was kind of earsplitting (I still have near-perfect hearing, somehow, so this might not bother you). I tried to make a fine adjustment on my phone, and I don't know if this is a phone thing or an earbud thing. I can usually get better volume tuning out of my computer, so it might just be my phone, but I don't recall having this issue with the Liberty 2 Pros. I've started noticing things I hadn't before on certain tracks, like background vocalizations on Golden Earring's \Twilight Zone\ or subtleties in Depeche Mode's \A Question of Lust,\ so another point for clarity. Wow. I'm reminded that some tracks are meant to be turned up and have a more muddled nature in their original recordings because they were meant to be disruptive, so I suppose it is what it is. APD is fun. The struggle is real. :/ I need a better budget, but again, for what they are, they're getting the job done nicely. I'm not sending them back. When I get better earbuds, I'll keep them as backups.

Just awesome! I would like to thank Soundcore/Anker for always having such great products at a price us 'low income' folks can afford. A few years back, I saved up and purchased $135 Google Pixel earbuds thinking they would be amazing, and they turned out to be the worst purchase ever. I had to deal with using them for a while due to not wanting to spend any more money on new earbuds. But when I heard about these earbuds and the affordable price of them, I thought, why not, most likely they will be better than what I have, and thankfully they are. The sound is great, the battery life is great, they are easy to use, they fit well in my ears, and I love that I have an app to change my desired sound of the buds. I now recommend them to everyone I talk to and also tell everyone to stay away from anything Pixel! You now have a loyal customer, Soundcore! I also love my gifted Bluetooth speaker made by you as well!

Good sound and easy on the wallet. I use them primarily for podcasts. They sound good - not great - as the overall sound is a bit lacking in depth for music. My main concern is that they retain their Bluetooth connectivity after repeated use. I have had several pairs of more expensive Soundcore earbuds that may sound a bit fuller, but they seem to lose their ability for both buds to connect after a few months. I figured I would try a less expensive model to see if they are more reliable.

Pretty good for the price. I've only used them a few times, so not a long-term review, but so far these are pretty nice for the low cost. Fit well and look good, and both music and podcasts sound clear. Not much bass but still sounds pretty darn good. The tap commands, like every earbud I've owned, work perfectly sometimes and sometimes you can't get it to work on the first tap. But again, for the low price, I can't really complain.

Amazing for the price. I bought these to replace the wired headset my work provided. My laptop dock is too far away from me, so I needed a wireless option. Compared to so many other earbuds, they are super inexpensive. They have great battery life. They're mostly pretty comfortable for long calls. For the price point, I'd give 4.5 - but they do have a few flaws. 1) They don't have a great range, so I still have to remain very close to my laptop. 2) I had to use one of the different rubber ear tips to fit my ears, but with those on, sometimes the case doesn't close all the way and I end up with uncharged earbuds sometimes. I solved it by setting a small book on top of them. 3) I haven't used them for music, only MS Teams meetings, but they can be a little crackly, so music might not be great. They serve my purpose nicely, though, so I am pretty well pleased with them.

Good for the price. One of my Soundcore P3s jumped down an elevator shaft, so I decided to replace it with something a little less expensive. Compared to the P3s, they have a flatter, tinnier sound, but really not bad. The battery life has been good. I don't use the noise cancellation much, but I know they help to tune out co-workers in an open office space, even without music playing. My one frustration is that the tapping controls almost never work, so I have to control everything with my phone. When I'm ready to invest in something more expensive, these will live at the office for calls and music while I'm working, and for that, they're just fine.

immerse yourself in audio bliss - Soundcore by Anker P20i true wireless earbuds certainly! Here's a sample review for the Soundcore by Anker P20i true wireless earbuds: Title: Immerse Yourself in Audio Bliss - Soundcore by Anker P20i True Wireless Earbuds I recently delved into the world of premium audio with the Soundcore by Anker P20i true wireless earbuds, and the experience has been nothing short of exceptional. These earbuds boast 10mm drivers with big bass, Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity, and a host of features that elevate the listening experience to a new level. Audio quality (5/5): The standout feature of the Soundcore P20i is undoubtedly the audio quality. The 10mm drivers deliver a rich and immersive soundstage. The big bass is not just a claim ‚Äì it's a visceral experience that adds depth and resonance to every beat. Whether it's crisp highs or powerful lows, these earbuds deliver a balanced and dynamic audio profile. Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity (5/5): The inclusion of Bluetooth 5.3 ensures a seamless and robust wireless connection. I've experienced reliable connectivity without dropouts or lag, providing the freedom to move around without being tethered to a device. The stability of the connection contributes to an uninterrupted listening experience. Comfortable fit (5/5): The ergonomic design of the earbuds ensures a comfortable and secure fit. They sit snugly in the ears without causing discomfort during extended use. The selection of ear tips allows for customization to find the perfect fit, enhancing both comfort and sound isolation. Sleek design (5/5): The sleek and minimalist design of the P20i earbuds adds a touch of sophistication. The compact charging case complements the earbuds and is easy to carry. The overall aesthetic appeal aligns with modern sensibilities, making these earbuds a stylish accessory. Intuitive touch controls (5/5): Navigating playback, adjusting volume, and answering calls are a breeze with the intuitive touch controls. The responsiveness of the controls adds to the overall user-friendly experience. It's a seamless way to interact with the earbuds without reaching for the connected device. Long battery life (5/5): The battery life of the Soundcore P20i is impressive. With extended playtime on a single charge and additional charges provided by the compact case, these earbuds are well-suited for all-day use. The convenience of not worrying about frequent recharging adds to their appeal. IPX4 water resistance (5/5): The IPX4 water resistance ensures that the earbuds can handle sweat and light splashes, making them suitable for workouts and outdoor activities. This feature adds durability and peace of mind, allowing users to enjoy their favorite music in various environments. Voice assistant compatibility (5/5): The compatibility with voice assistants is a thoughtful addition. Whether summoning Siri or Google Assistant, the hands-free control adds a layer of convenience. It's a feature that aligns with the modern smart device ecosystem. Transparent mode (5/5): The transparent mode is a game-changer for those moments when awareness of the surroundings is crucial. Activating this mode allows ambient sounds to pass through, enhancing safety during outdoor activities or when needing to stay attuned to the environment. Conclusion: In conclusion, the Soundcore by Anker P20i true wireless earbuds offer a premium audio experience with their exceptional audio quality, Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity, comfortable fit, sleek design, intuitive touch controls, long battery life, IPX4 water resistance, voice assistant compatibility, and transparent mode. These earbuds cater to audiophiles and casual listeners alike, providing a versatile and immersive sound experience. Highly recommended for those who appreciate cutting-edge technology and superior audio performance.

Good affordable options. I really liked them so far, but have had two issues worth mentioning. The first is, for whatever reason, the right one sometimes doesn't charge no matter how long I leave it in the case, even if the case has a full charge. This is solved by charging the case and having the buds in them when I do so. Second, the touch controls are really unreliable at times. You can download the app to change the settings, and the settings are saved on the hardware so you can delete the app afterwards. But I've just had times where the touch commands just refuse to work. That said, it's still a good-priced product. Nice sound, good battery life, small enough to carry discreetly.

Surprisingly high quality! I‚Äôm a bit of an audiophile when it comes to headphones/earphones. I did not expect much with this purchase and was looking for a pair to wear out and keep at work. These earbuds sound amazing for the price, far from those mosquito-sounding earphones or headphones you‚Äôd expect to find from the dollar or discount stores. Battery life seems great, though over the long term I am unsure of the earphones' longevity. Nonetheless, as with all Bluetooth audio, battery life will diminish, and for this price, it‚Äôs a steal.

Love them!! Honestly, it's amazing these are so cheap!! The earbuds are loud, they hold charges really well and last a long time, don't even take a lot of time to charge! I haven't had any issue with them disconnecting or fitting weird. They connect easily to your device so you don't have to go through a bunch of hassle to get that set up or anything. They're great. They should cost way more considering how great they are tbh.

Good quality for the price. I have JBL earbuds and it cost me triple of these earbuds. The sound quality is the same as the battery life. They feel a little cheap but look good and sound good, which is the most important. If they go bad with time, I will definitely buy another pair.

Good sound quality. The sound quality on these seemed good to me. I had planned to use them for walks and I think they would have done well. People could hear me just fine when I used the microphone. The only problem I had was I couldn‚Äôt get them to stay in my ears, which was a bummer because I really wanted to keep them. I ended up returning them because of that.

Pairing and connecting, I just got these but so far so good. My last pair was giving me problems with pairing and they were sooooo annoying. These connect so easily, but I do have a problem with hanging up calls because the instructions don't help much. For the price, I won't complain much.

Fantastic! This is my second pair, I bought this pair because I've had my original pair for so long that the app does not support that model. They are my favorite earbuds, I bought them at a Verizon store two or three years ago and they are fantastic. Reliable, great battery life. Highly highly recommend this brand!

AirPod killers needed a quick solution for a long flight tomorrow after AirPod lost. These are insane for $20. Connected immediately and sound is absolutely as good as AirPods. I can‚Äôt imagine what the P40 sounds like for $50. Sure - doesn‚Äôt have the same features - but straight sound - absolutely equal. Can drown out crying baby and fighting spouses on airplane rides with the best of them.

Not really for adults with smaller ears. Good battery life! Sound quality is pretty average, but good for the price. I purchased these so I could listen to videos on my phone once in a while. It comes with 3 pairs of different-sized earpieces; however, in my case, none of them keep the earbuds in my ear for very long. If you have smaller than average ears for an adult, be prepared to keep having to readjust these before they fall out of your ear.

Awesome sound for $20. I love this brand. I have had their Bluetooth speakers as well as different boomboxes, and all I can say is Anker/Soundcore products are a great value. This review is for the P20i earbuds. Wireless with excellent bass response, and you can add more with Bass Up or make your own equalizer in the Soundcore app. I mainly got these for mowing grass as the wire from my old earbuds kept getting in the way. These earbuds solved that problem, and they sound absolutely amazing. No static, feedback, or buzzing. No pairing issues. I've had nothing but good experiences with this brand and look forward to trying more of their products. These earbuds slap if you are a bass head, but they also slap for podcasts with the adjustable EQs. Would recommend and will definitely try the upgraded version when mine go kaput.

Great for the price. Accidentally dropped one in the pool. Went straight to the bottom. Set it out in the indirect sun, hot out, for like 10 minutes. Still works great and that was a week ago. Sound is great, battery is satisfactory, and they charge faster than the directions say at 2 hrs. I love these things.

Feels like expensive earbuds!!! Easily the best budget earbuds I have purchased. This doesn't feel or look like budget earbuds, sound is so good and loud. Don't forget to use the Soundcore app to customize the experience. Very comfortable to wear for hours. Surprisingly good call quality where even expensive earbuds fail miserably.

Work great! These are great earbuds, I wanted AirPods but couldn‚Äôt afford them and honestly, these are better. I have smaller ears and the Apple AirPods have always been too big and fall out of my ear, these have the ear tip like the AirPod Pros, which I loooove! I've never had any connection issues or anything, work for both Android and Apple!!

Don't think about it, just buy them! I couldn't believe my ears the first song I played through them. After just retiring my AirPods Pro headphones that cost me $200, I reluctantly tried these for an insane $24.00, and I was blown away at how close they sound to the $200 Apple AirPods. I played ABBA's \Take a Chance on Me,\ and the highs and lows were superb. Seriously, what's not to love? If these last one year, I'll be a happy camper. Going to buy another pair now before they raise the price to a more reasonable price (a much higher price). Unbelievable! Thank you, Anker!

Very nice. I was skeptical about its noise cancelling before purchasing, but once I started using it, I have to say it's impressive. I use it whenever I am traveling, so I can tell you it works really well in noisy environments. I have been close to airplanes, and it comfortably lowers loud jet engine noises. Also, the battery life is very impressive. Overall, a good product.

Works but not well. With these headphones you really do get what you pay for. The way you control the buds is by touch & not a button. I need a button. I need a button. My fingers were burned as a child & touch screens are hit & miss for me. I typically use a stylus at all times on my Samsung Note phone; it's that bad. The other Soundcore products I've bought all had buttons, so I didn't even think this model might not. So I can turn the buds on by taking them out of the case, but I can't actually do anything with them. The only way I've gotten the touch to work is to literally rub the buds up against my knuckle, which really doesn't work well at all with an earbud on the go. This probably won't be a problem for other people, but for me, it's a real issue. I was going to use these for walks, but since none of the controls work for me (again because of my skin deformity, not the buds being horrible), I decided to use these with my Nintendo Switch. Walking & taking my phone out repeatedly was going to be a hassle. But with a game system, you don't need to do anything but change volume & that control is on the device you are already using in your hand anyways, so it won't matter. As a walking in the park earbud, they stink. As loafing with my Pok√©mon on the couch set, they are actually really great. I've had the buds for a few weeks now & I've not yet had the buds run out of battery while playing my Switch. But I generally don't play my Switch longer than 2-3 hours at a time with the buds on. Or if I do, I pop them back in the case while I go potty, make some lunch, check on laundry, yell at the cat, etc., so I'm not really sure about battery life. If they had buttons not touch controls, they would be 5 stars for the price. And I really can't say how good the sound quality is or if they stay in while you move around because I use them on low volume while laying on the couch. But they haven't fallen out of my ears yet, so that's something.

Great little earbuds. I've been using these earbuds for about two weeks so I can't really speak about longevity, but so far these have been great. I mostly wear them to work out in the gym and they haven't disappointed. The fit is comfortable with the cushions that came on them, but there are several sizes included so you can customize them to fit better. I am by no means an audiophile, but I find that the sound is pretty good with plenty of bass. For reference, I mostly listen to classic rock, if that helps. I didn't want to spend a lot of money because I tend to lose things and feel like these are perfect for my needs and the price point.

Big sound, little package. I bought these mainly to use to make and receive calls. They work flawlessly. You can use just one if you like or both. It's got me playing my favorite music while mowing or on the tractor. Beautiful sound. Charge lasts a long time. Would recommend to anyone. Good value.

Awesome sound! Great-sounding earbuds. They are well-made. Comparing them to the AirPods Pro, you cannot hear surrounding sounds clearly as they dampen surrounding noise. The case is a little flimsy. How can you complain though for $25 earbuds? Great bang for the buck! No need for me to waste money on AirPods anymore. The 4 out of 5 stars is due to the flimsy case. Beef up the case and it would be 5 out of 5.

Love 'em! When it comes to earbuds, there are two things that I look for to stand out over anything else and that's how comfortably they fit in my ear and the bass/volume. I must say that this brand nailed those two things perfectly! I feel like I got my money's worth! Easy to pair with my phone and battery life is amazing as well. Wish there were more colors available. Definitely feel like I got my bang for my buck.

Great price, recently bought another brand in the same price point and this pair is clearer and the charge blows away any expensive brand I've purchased before. Haven't had them long enough to know if the charge and streaming time will maintain its current level.

Great deal for the price. The sound quality on these headphones is good for my needs. I love the battery life; I still have not had to charge them, and I have probably worn them for well over 6 hours in total, and I still have over half of the full charge on the headphone case. The only downfall of these is the touch control on the earpieces seems to be somewhat temperamental. Sometimes they seem to follow the commands, and other times it seems like it doesn‚Äôt work at all. Otherwise, I am very happy with these, especially for the price.

Great headphones. I lost one of my iPods and they were too expensive to buy again. I looked for an alternative and I found these. I was apprehensive initially because of the price. I figured they would stop working after a few times but since it was only $20, I didn't have much to lose. These earbuds are perfect, lightweight, good sound quality for calls and for music. I recommend these if you're on a budget and want bang for your buck.

Strong first impression synced with my Android phone right out of the box. Stayed in my ears through a sweaty workout at the gym with no issues. Sound is clear with decent bass. Case is compact and doesn't take up much room in the pocket. Big step up from the Skullcandy wireless buds I've been using. For the price, I don't think you can go wrong with these! Oh, and the blue color looks really nice in person.

Amazing for the price! I loved these earphones. Everything is a plus - size, lightweight, sound quality, microphone, and find my earphone functionality offered by Soundcore via the app. Unfortunately, I have to return these as prolonged use of in-ear buds feels constant pressure put into my ears. Switching to headphones for now.

Great earbuds only used for a small amount of time but the sound quality is great, they cancel out most outside sound and I have relatively small ears and these are the first bud style that don't feel like they're going to fall out.

So far so good. I bought these to replace a pair of JBL earbuds that had given up charging the right bud after a year and a half. I've only had these for about a month now and so far so good. The battery life has been terrific. I've only had to charge them once so far. To be fair, I only use them about an hour a day, so they're not getting taxed. The sound quality is good for what I use them for - my daily workouts and is getting better as they burn in. I could probably dial them in even better if I'd download the Soundcore app with the equalizer and all, but I'm kind of app-averse, so that may or may not happen. The noise cancellation, at least to me, is nothing to write home about. Again, this may be something in the app that can be enabled/tweaked, so take this comment for what it's worth. Overall, for 20 bucks, they work just fine. The key for me will be how well they work or hold a charge 2 years from now. For now, I'm happy with the purchase.

Great sound, comfortable, nice upgrade from my other pair (brand) at an amazing price. I was never happy with my old earbuds' fit, and started getting static with my phone in my pocket. These buds fit great, have great sound, and no static so very satisfied.

Only buds that work with my Linux distro after trying Monoprice and Aukey Bluetooth earbuds with no success, these work fine on my Linux PCLOS distribution. In fairness, both the above work fine with Windows and Android phone. These Ankers also slip back into the case easier than most. My only con might be the listening time on the first try was more like 3 hrs. That's fine for most things but binging whole seasons of streaming programs, which is not good for practice anyhow.

Great for about 3 months, these worked well for the first 3 months. Now the left earbud has incredibly low, muffled volume and is basically unusable. Edited to add another star purely for customer service. The company worked with me to replace the defective headphone.

Great value. I'd give a five-star rating based on value and ease of use, but let's face it, the sound lacks a little depth for classical music. Still, I'm quite satisfied and happy to have bought them. I was drawn to them by the Anker brand because I have other Anker products that are good, and these do not disappoint.

bass heavy by default but,.. it works and the battery lasts so far i don't have any problems with the operation and quality of the device. i have small ear canals so i might have to get some foam earbuds to replace the silicone ones that come with the device because even the smallest one, though it fits, isn't quite the right size but that's always been a problem for me. i'll just get some aftermarket ones like the jlab cloud foam and see if that works. i didn't do a ton of research and just got these because of the price and brand but if you're planning to game on your phone the delay on audio in things like codm might bother you like it did me. the footsteps are just a fraction of a second later than i'd want at least on my device it doesn't support changes in sample rate or ldac codec so i couldn't change any settings to see if the delay could be reduced in any way. i've found no reason to be at max volume since it's loud enough long before that. the default preset is bass heavy but the app allows you to reduce the bass and change the function when you tap, double tap or long press them when wearing one or both. i'm not the type to listen to music all day but i was kinda surprised the first time the battery low warning came on.

Great sound for the money. I'm still learning how to operate them. The sound quality is very nice and they charge quickly. I have trouble fitting earpieces, but these are sitting snug and comfortably in my ear. Can't say yet how long they will last as I have only had them 3 days.

Excellent headphones, especially for the price. They were easy to pair with my phone and work as much as I need them to. If you want just a simple pair of headphones that will last you a while for a decent price, these are the ones!

Great deal so I don't know what's so special about $140 iPods but I got these for less than $30 bucks and they do the job. I use them while I work and battery lasts for my whole shift. Plus it cancels out all the noise. Definitely recommend.

Winner forget the rest. I work out in the gym where it is noisy, weights being slammed, bros talking loudly. Sometimes I want to tune out the world and just hear my music. I tried beans from Samsung; they were good for 1 year, then issues with the earplug started occurring. I bought the Apple ones - those are junk and are the worst. I saw the Soundcore and figured, what the heck, let me give it a go. Was I surprised? These were a hit. I use these instead of the beans and forget about the Apple ones; they are junk.

Best in the price range you‚Äôre looking for a pair of earbuds that won‚Äôt set you back a ton but don‚Äôt sound like trash. This is the pair. Actually, they‚Äôre underpriced. Audiophiles will probably be able to point to the sound deficiencies of these buds, but for around $20, who‚Äôs actually expecting a sonic carnival? The fit? That always depends on your ears. AirPod first gen always falls out of my ear. Bought a cheap pair of Tozo and they also fall out. These have always stayed in, but that‚Äôs my ear. Now, I‚Äôve only had them a couple of weeks, so can‚Äôt attest to their battery life or any connectivity issues some of the low ratings have noted. So far, however, these are a steal for the price.

Great earbuds, another great product from Anker. These earbuds have great sound and nice bass. The only reason they're not a 5-star is the lack of sizes for the piece that you put in your ear. Other than that, absolutely great earbuds.

Great headphones work like AirPods. The headphones are great, I use them for work and they work like a charm. Good replacement for someone who needs decent headphones, especially if you want to use in case of breaking or losing them. The microphone could be better but does the job. Easy to pair together and fit well in my ear. Generally a good pick!

Great product! The earbuds reach at least the length of half an Olympic pool. I never lost the music as I walked in the water. They never fall out as I walk in the pool. Easy to program after some research and trial and error. Highly recommend.

Good product, very good sound quality, battery, and ease of connectivity! The only thing missing from 5/5 stars is active noise cancelling. If it had this option, it would be the biggest competitor, but for the price, it is perfect for what you get!

early impressions ‚Ä¢ first of all, i love that these arrived a day early. i desperately needed some dependable earbuds after the ones i had began to randomly turn and pocket drain. ‚Ä¢ i got my package opened it up, took the pictures above, then i plugged them to charge for my night shift at work. ‚Ä¢ i did not try them beforehand, because earpiece looked the same size as my other pair. while wearing these at work sitting down on break they fell out of my ears several times without much movement. when i got home i opened the spare pieces and there was a smaller one so now these fit perfectly. sound quality seems nice so far no complaints. - i have not had a phone call yet so i may return to update that.

Great product and customer service. I ordered these as I'm a fan of Anker products in general, and I've been happy with other Soundcore earbuds in the past. They definitely don‚Äôt disappoint in the quality of the sound and ease of use. The only issue I had was they would unpair sporadically. I reached out to Soundcore support, and we tried some troubleshooting. When that didn‚Äôt resolve the issue, they promptly offered to replace them. That is why I‚Äôll keep buying Anker! Not every product rolls off the line perfect, but not every company has customer service this good. For sure, buy these for the sound quality, but if you‚Äôre iffy about that, get them for the quality of the company.

Best earphones, the quality is top-notch. I have been an AirPods person for years. These are just as good, if not better than the AirPods for a fraction of the cost. The noise-canceling is better than any headphone I have ever had. Cannot recommend enough.

better than a lot of other earbuds useful- i can easily take calls and these connect to phones, computers, and anything else with bluetooth good sound- definitely on the bass-y side (my preference) with good solid sound overall. punchier than what many earbuds (and even some headphones) deliver. good distance connection from devices as well. no noise canceling, but that‚Äôs not a problem. the only caveat is that my right earbud (when playing solo) likes to skip forward occasionally.

Good quality. I bought a Soundcore headset a while back and it ended up malfunctioning only after a few months of having them. I found out it was a common problem within that brand, so I bought earbuds hoping it won‚Äôt happen to these! So far, the sound is great and it is very easy to pair to my phone.

I like them much more than I should. What a great price for an astounding set of earbuds. They paired with no issues. The charger is great. The Android app has plenty of customization... and they sound great. I've just used them for 2 hours and they still have almost a complete charge. I left my phone on the desk in my office and walked around the house with no problem with disconnects. Anker did a great job on these babies!

Works great, does its job, lasts long without recharging. I‚Äôm happy with it. 4 stars because some people don‚Äôt hear me at times, but I can‚Äôt prove it‚Äôs not the quality. But overall, I would buy it again. Had it for 3 months.

Great product for the price. They came charged, so that was nice. The case feels cheap and the sound is a bit dull, but for $20, they work great! They also stay stuck in the ear and connect to my device easily.

Good product, good price. I found these to be easy to use, good sound quality, quick charge, and last all day. I would recommend to a friend. Heck, I‚Äôll even go so far as to recommend them to all you strangers out there. They‚Äôre even cheap enough to grab a pair just to have around as a spare.

You need these for under $50, you can't beat this deal. Right out of the box I was impressed. Charged them up and took to the gym. They don't fall out, totally shake your head proof, great life, sound quality is just as good as my Beats buds.

Very cute and good quality! This was one of my best purchases. They are super comfortable with great fit (don‚Äôt slip off), audio quality and noise cancellation are both great, and the battery life lasts very long. I love most of all that it has hands-free calling, which allows me to multitask throughout my day while being able to speak with family and business. Not to mention they are very cute and sleek, especially the pink color. 10/10 recommend these.

Fantastic headphones! These JBL headphones are an excellent buy! They are made with a bit smaller ear can size. I especially love the way it is made with several bendable joints so that they can be folded up smaller when needed. The charge holds for nearly a week, even when using daily several times. The sound quality is excellent. I absolutely love these headphones and recommend them wholeheartedly!

Cute, affordable, and good quality! These are so cute!! I use them when I‚Äôm tanning and going to the gym, and they hold up perfectly fine. The sound is good quality and is easy to connect to your phone. They‚Äôre also pretty durable; I‚Äôve dropped these on the ground a handful of times, and they still work and no scratches! The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that if I have my music a little too loud, you can start hearing it through the headphones, and I hate when other people can hear my music. Overall, these are cute and work well for a good price. I definitely recommend!!!

Good quality but can be uncomfortable. Great quality with good sound, excellent call quality, and easy to connect. However, the tension between the earpieces is quite strong, so the pressure can be uncomfortable if you wear them for a long time. There's also a pressure point on top of the head, even after adjusting for size. I tried a different set of headphones that my son had, and it was definitely more comfortable. The price point on these was good, so I will try them a little longer.

The sound quality is perfect. They are comfortable. First, I'd like to say the price was affordable for JBL headphones. I own only JBL products when it comes to Bluetooth speakers and headphones. Their sound quality is the best as well as the battery life and quality of their products. After ordering, the package came very fast and was easy to open. The product was fully charged and very easy to connect to my cell phone. I had to charge my phone before the headphones, lol. Overall, 10 out of 10 would definitely recommend to everyone.

Get these! Super sturdy, long battery life, and great sound quality! I purchased these headphones in November 2022 and am finally putting them to rest today, May 2024. I got them on sale for $25 for studying as I started my graduate program. Pros: 1. Personally, I don't like 100% noise-canceling headphones because I like to be aware of my surroundings and if people are trying to talk to me. But they cancel enough of background noise to keep my ADHD attention span in check. So if you want to completely ignore the world, these may not be for you. The sound quality is very loud and clear, and the volume doesn't have to be turned up that much, either. 2. So durable. I am surprised these lasted for as long as they did. I was waiting for them to crap out a year ago with how I was using them. I take them to the gym; sweating on the earmuff part was kind of gross, but I cleaned it with alcohol after, and it still held up great. These have also been my go-to for traveling. I've brought them on many plane rides, fallen asleep with them in weird angles, shoved them in many packed backpacks and suitcases, and have been dropped quite a bit. Still worked and sounded beautifully. 3. Battery life is nearly immortal. I forget to charge these because of how long they last. I used them all week to study, maybe 4-5 hours a day, 5 days a week, and would charge them every two weeks or so. 4. I also use these for work calls and Zoom meetings, and they have worked better than any of my expensive Galaxy Buds or whatever Anker earbuds. Cons: 1. Misshapen. I'm not even mad about this. Maybe I have a big head or maybe it was all the roughhousing it's gone through, but the band area is a little stretched but expected for normal wear and tear. 2. $50? Got too popular and expensive for poor grad students like me. TLDR: Buy these! I'm sad to see them go but I'm definitely getting another pair once the price drops. I got a pair for my mom and she loves them too!

sound quality. depending on the model, JBL headphones come packed with features such as: active noise cancelling (ANC): effective at reducing ambient noise, enhancing your listening experience. Bluetooth connectivity: stable and easy pairing with multiple devices. Battery life: impressive battery performance, with some models offering up to 20-30 hours of playback on a single charge. Built-in microphone: clear call quality and convenient voice assistant integration. Touch controls: intuitive touch controls for playback, volume, and call management.

Love them! Use them daily! Great sound quality with no bleed. Use daily at the gym, during walks, or even just around the house when I'm listening to audiobooks. Fits great. I will say, I have small ears and I like the fit. My husband tried them and they didn't fit his ears and were uncomfortable, just something to keep in mind. Great quality for the price!

Decent at 30 bucks, I got these yesterday, on sale for $28 or so. I wanted something to use while doing work/chores/phone calls. I‚Äôve been using Bluetooth Skullcandy in-ear headphones, but they annoy my ears after wearing them for a long time, or daily. Also, no one can tell you have headphones in, so I wanted something obvious. People tend to leave you alone then!! :) Summary at the bottom if you don‚Äôt want to read my words! First out of the box, I charged them for 5 minutes and tried them. Initially, I was impressed, bass was good, sound was pretty clear. I listen to a lot of metal, and I‚Äôm very particular about what I am able to hear. All around, it seemed pretty good! Could be better in some areas, but again, I‚Äôm trying to keep in mind they were 30 bucks. Cons after wearing them for the rest of the day to test them out, some things came up. The louder you turn them up, the more flat or muddy/messy the sound gets. Bass, in general, seems to wash out a bit? I want to hear my drums, man! And one does not *quietly* listen to metal music. Not possible! It will not cover the noise of a weed whacker/mower, but I wasn‚Äôt fully expecting them to. I‚Äôd say it cuts half the sound out. Also, it seems to pick up sound? My in-ears have a ‚Äústay aware‚Äù option, where it plays the ambient noise while wearing. While this isn‚Äôt equipped with that, it sure seems to let certain noises through loudly. It‚Äôs odd. Like my dog barking, I can hear that almost as clear as day. Might just be me? Pros phone calls? Perfect. I can hear the other person clearly, they can hear me clearly. I have no issues with that area at all. Super comfy, no ear discomfort at all. Battery kicks ass, lightweight, buttons are nice, not too close together to fat-finger the wrong one. So I‚Äôm mixed, I know it‚Äôs a lower-end headset but was hoping to keep true sound, and bass, the louder it got. Love the phone calls and comfort, battery is great. If you‚Äôre looking for a starter, or for kids, these are great! Or just something to make calls with, this is fantastic.

Good headphones for sound only overall: For the price, good headphones if you are not using them for the mic and/or calls. There are some connection issues (but that may not happen with every pair, it may just be mine!) I bought these headphones in November 2023 and as of today, August 2024, they won‚Äôt connect to my phone anymore. The audio still works and it‚Äôs a decent audio, but it definitely is not the same as it used to be. The audio was the best for the first 4-5 months of having them. Now, they do not have as clear or loud of a sound and the bass is nowhere near as good. They still connect to my laptop, but I‚Äôve tried everything possible and they will not connect to my phone anymore. Ever since I got them, I've had random small issues with connections, audio, and the built-in mic. I‚Äôm gonna make a list of the random things that have happened off and on ever since I've bought these headphones (just cause lists are easier!): - When in a call (specifically when watching someone screen share), the audio will randomly become extremely static and distorted and I can‚Äôt understand a single word. I have figured out no way to fix this other than waiting for it to stop. - The mic is just not good at all and never has been good. Either no one can hear me or I'm breaking up. The only way people can hear me is if I take the headphones off and speak directly into the tiny hole where the mic is. - When I‚Äôm in a call with someone and trying to watch something in the background, the audio of the video or the music is horrible. I don‚Äôt know how to describe it other than a muffled deep-fried distortion (if you know what I mean.) This is possibly normal but I‚Äôve not experienced this with other headphones/earbuds. - The headphones occasionally will say they‚Äôre connected to my phone and/or laptop, yet they‚Äôll actually be connected to neither. I‚Äôll turn them on and the blue light will stay solid (indicating it‚Äôs connected) and on my laptop and phone it‚Äôll say the headphones are connected via Bluetooth, but when I go to play something, it doesn‚Äôt play through my headphones. It will either play through my devices‚Äô speakers or play nothing at all. To fix this I turn off my Bluetooth and turn off the headphones, then turn both back on and it will usually connect and play correctly. - Lastly, there have been a few times where I just couldn‚Äôt get my headphones to connect to anything at all. I‚Äôve figured out that this only happens when the headphones are around 15-30% charged. On top of this, I will have to say that I feel like the battery life has diminished a lot since I first bought them. I wanna add that I've done research and tried lots of things and troubleshooted lots to figure out if this was a device issue or headphones issue, and it is indeed a headphones issue. Specifically, these connection issues have never happened with any of my other Bluetooth headphones or earbuds. I do recommend these if you only need them for music or maybe streaming shows, movies, YouTube. But these headphones are not the best option if you are looking for a good mic.

stand up pair of ear on headphones I recently purchased the JBL Tune 510BT wireless headphones and I have to say, JBL is truly an amazing brand that never disappoints. These headphones are not only comfortable to wear for extended periods, but they are also incredibly easy to use. The sound quality of the JBL Tune 510BT headphones is exceptional, delivering crisp highs, rich mids, and deep bass that truly immerses you in your music or podcasts. The wireless connectivity is seamless, allowing me to move around freely without any tangled cords getting in the way. I love how lightweight and comfortable these headphones are, making them perfect for long listening sessions or workouts. The adjustable headband and cushioned ear cups provide a snug and secure fit, ensuring that they stay in place no matter what I'm doing. Overall, I am thoroughly impressed with the JBL Tune 510BT wireless headphones. JBL has once again proven why they are a trusted and reliable brand in the audio industry. If you're looking for headphones that deliver exceptional sound quality, comfort, and ease of use, look no further than the JBL Tune 510BT. They are a true standout in the world of wireless headphones.

son loves these my son has been rough on headphones. he's 8 and isn't ready for earbuds, nor did he really want them, but he wanted wireless headphones. saw these on sale and he picked the color. he hasn't had any complaints and loves how they fold up. they seem to charge pretty quickly and he quickly found out the controls and how to connect the Bluetooth. he says these are his favorite headphones and that they're comfortable. he wears them on his walks with me every morning and evening when he decides to go.

I hit it out of the park with this one. My husband works nights by himself and listens to a lot of news. His headphones went kaput, and he needed a new set for working that night. I found these, and they were on the front porch within 4 hours. I charged them while he slept, he synced them, put them on, and said they were better than the ones he had. The ones he had were about $80 more than these. More expensive isn't always better, in my opinion.

Cute! The sound is really nice, they do have some noise cancelling although they aren‚Äôt advertised as noise cancelling but I did notice some background noises were not noticeable. My only ick is that the headphones don‚Äôt adjust much. They adjust decently but a person with a large head or lots of hair may not have a comfortable fit with these. I also wish they came with a carrying case, it maybe I‚Äôm asking for too much from $30 headphones lol. I would recommend.

They fit too tight... these are not properly sized to fit well. The clamping pressure on your ears is too high. So, I could not wear them for long. I fixed that with a short length of 1/8 steel rod from a home center or hardware store and two zip ties (wire ties). This flattens out the top curve of the headband, spreading the ear cups apart and that removes the pressure. When you do that, the ear cups will be riding higher on your head so you may have to compromise. Adjusting the pressure is easy. You just slide the zip ties in for tighter and out for looser. With that problem under control, I like them very much. The battery runs for a long time and recharge time is well under an hour. They automatically sleep after a while so I don't even bother shutting them off. I simply recharge them every few days.

Great sound, wish ear pads were larger. I have a very difficult time with earbuds due to my tiny ear canals and not having them stay in. I've always used headphones more comfortably. These are very clear with the sound and the padding on the earphone part is comfortable. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the size of the ear pad; it was very small and I have tiny ears as it is. I was expecting it to be larger, so that it actually covered over the ear, but they are the only pair that I have had that if I needed to sleep with them on, I could do so comfortably.

Not the loudest but enough. Not the loudest but enough. Smaller-sized earmuffs made it more comfortable for a smaller person not to feel so bulky. I have the wired ones, quite very similar. No complaints. The only issue is it seems the wireless ones are a bit wider on the head, so these seem to not stay on me snug. They do slide when I lean forward. Not a lot of bass or great noise reduction, but as stated in the title, it's enough for basic living. They were actually thrown against a steel door, and they are still just going, so I guess they're pretty durable. Not a bad price, though I would like to hear a little more boom.

Cute! I recently just received these headphones and have been wearing them all day since they arrived today. After wearing them all day, I can definitely say they are very stylish and cute. My head is really small, so I was really happy that they don‚Äôt appear bulky. The sound is amazing and very easy to control. However, one thing I did notice while I was outside today is that my ears and the area around them grew sweaty easily. I could definitely tell that the rubber around the headphones will wear out easily after consistently wearing them for a while. Other than that, I absolutely love it.

Very good product for the price. I have purchased multiple sets of headphones on Amazon, each from a different brand name. This set connects easiest to the Bluetooth on my laptop. As long as it's turned on, it connects & it has an excellent range. The downside - there is no hole for the traditional connector. There are times when a cord is necessary for me. For instance, my Bluetooth on desktop is faulty and using the C charger to connect to the computer doesn't work for anything but charging. The sound is good. The headset stays on when I bend over (which is not always true of other brands). The padding is comfortable. I would definitely consider JBL for future purchases. Bose does have a better sound, but the difference in quality is tiny compared to the difference in cost. And JBL really is easier to connect. Hopefully they last longer than my previous pairs.

Pretty dang good. So I was looking for something to drown out the noise and whining from 4 girls. Trust me, I was on the hunt. At first I was a little hesitant because I‚Äôve worked for electronics stores before and I know what good quality sounds like. But these are actually a phenomenal budget option. My girls talked to me all morning but I couldn‚Äôt hear them over the Bee Gees.

Only issue is they slide off my head sometimes. I kept having issues with losing or them not functioning well when I was buying the little earbuds. These are super cute and comfy. I mainly use them when I am working out in the gym. The only issue I have with them sometimes is when I lay down or bend over, they slide right off my head. I tried to tighten them but I don't want to snap them in half. I do love when you turn them on, they sound like a sports car starting. (I am a dork like that hehe)

Just what we needed. I ordered these for my 10-year-old daughter to use with her iPad, and they are great. The charge lasts a long time, and the ear pads are comfortable and cancel out surrounding noise. She even wears them sometimes during loud thunderstorms because the noise scares her. They came with a cute little case to store them in as well. Would definitely buy again.

Great for the price. I purchased these headphones for my preteen and she loves them. She loves the on-ear fit, as they aren't as bulky as over-the-ear headphones she's used in the past. I only took one star away because they don't have any water resistance and we had to purchase another pair after a minor exposure to water.

Our go-to headphones; everyone in our family (kids and adults) has a pair! We went through a few other headphones, and the ear parts kept breaking from kid use or being left out. These ones are super durable! Sound quality is great, and they‚Äôre comfortable to wear for longer periods of time.

Updated: operator error! Update: the instructions are lame, but if you keep looking, you will find the correct input for the charging cord. I posted the cord didn't fit, but when I gave them another inch by inch look, I found the correct input. The sound is awesome! I give them 5 stars all the way around! I bought a pair of these as a Christmas present last year and my grandson loved them. I purchased a set for me as my old ones stopped charging. This set arrived on time and are very nice. However, the charging cord does not fit into the slot on the headset. Hopefully JBL will send the correct charging cord as I really do not want to go through the process of returning for a replacement.

Work great, got them for dad. Wears them in bed to watch the tablet. Lighter and sound better than the last pair, some off-brand. These were on sale so I got JBLs for a good price. I think brand name may matter a little.

Excellent for watching TV product saved my marriage. Husband's new job requires him to get out of bed at 3:00 am, requiring him to go to sleep at 9:00 pm. Now, with this product I can view my TV, watch all my shows and even my Netflix series, and he doesn't hear a thing. Of course, these crazy hours do not help our romance!

Great alternative to earbuds! I think I must have the world's waxiest ears or something because after countless attempts at finding the right pair, none have managed to stay in my ears. So, I finally gave up the ghost and tried these JBL over-the-ear headset, and I must say I am really pleased. I thought they would be cumbersome and bulky compared to the bud experience I was looking for originally. These are lightweight and comfortable and have just enough noise-canceling abilities to make me feel immersed but still aware of my surroundings, which is a must for me! I haven't experienced any ear fatigue after several hours of continual wear, which was another apprehension for me. I simply hate sore ears after wearing headphones. Overall, these are a great alternative to earbuds for me. I don't feel like I am missing any of the major perks of buds here. They travel well and sound amazing!

Good for the price. I originally purchased these thinking they were noise-canceling while doing yard work or working in the garage. While not noise-canceling, they do work great and sound great as well. I just crank up the volume to drown out lawnmower, string trimmer, edger, whatever...

Perfect over-the-ear headphones. This is the first type of this kind of headphone I've purchased. The sound is exceptional. The ear foams do make me sweat a little, especially when I wear them to the gym, but I expect that happens with all of them. Great quality for the low price.

They definitely cancel noise, wonderful fit and not too heavy for my ears! The sound is amazing and unless someone is literally next to your ear, they can't hear anything really. The sound is great, battery quality fantastic, and listening to music/phone calls amazing!

Great sound for the price. These headphones have great sound and so far have connected easily to my iPhone via Bluetooth. The downside, however, for me is that they are somewhat uncomfortable to wear because the headphone cups are somewhat small and are not over-the-ear headphones. I decided to switch to Beats Studio Pro headphones because they are over-the-ear and better quality, but they do cost a lot more.

Solid headphones for the money. The battery lasts seemingly forever. I charge it about twice a month and use it every day at the gym - so I'm guessing it lasts about 40 hours or so on a charge. That's fantastic. But I'm not sure how long it'll last me since the film on the earpiece is incredibly thin, and I'm afraid that once it starts to flake a little, it'll all come off. It's been five months at this point, but I'm already looking for a pair with a more durable liner for the ears that will last through the workout abuse longer.

Sound quality is good, fit is good, mic is eh. I have just bought a second pair. The price is great for quality. Music is full and bass-y. The mic quality when I'm on a call is not noise-canceling; it picks up everything going on in the background. Otherwise, the fit is snug on my head, the controls are easy to figure out, and they look nice. I wear these when I'm exercising, and they stay just fine.

I love them so much! I originally bought these for work (call center) and they worked great for that. I ended up switching jobs and just used them for my day-to-day. Then I went on a trip and lost them, and I‚Äôm re-ordering because I love them too much! They also made me feel so classy/girly (pink ones). Just get them!!! You won‚Äôt regret it.

Great for kids! I bought this for my daughter because her AirPods would fall out of her ear (they were too big and hand-me-downs). She loves them and takes them everywhere. The noise-canceling works too well because I have to yell for her to react and answer me. The battery life is good and lasts 2 days before needing to charge them. She loves the girly color (baby pink).

Love the hole for your ear in the foam is a tad small. I have pretty big ears so long extended wear at first hurts. Easy to set up, volume control is perfect. The durability seems unmatched for the price. They are wireless so portability is great. They are easy to adjust as well.

Nice, especially for the price. It was easy to set up and works decently. It feels a little on the cheap side, but they are low cost, so... I think the charging port is in a bad spot (between the ear cup and the headband).
Quality the headphones are comfortable. The audio quality is great. Connecting to Bluetooth is very quick and the price for JBL headphones is so good. I recommend them and I would buy them again.

These headphones are a steal! They were such a good investment! I use them all the time and hardly ever need to charge them. They are great outdoors or cleaning the house. Amazing sound quality, almost too good that I forgot I have them on and will start singing. They are so easy to control and use and comfortable to wear for long periods of time.

size is too small sound and bass quality are great, this headset would be perfect for the price if the ear muffs weren't so small. i used these at the gym for about an hour and since it didn‚Äôt cover my ears completely they were a little sore afterwards. other than the size everything else is great

Good product. I have been using these headphones for over a year. I use them to go to the gym and to run. They are constantly wet because of the sweat and they are still in excellent condition. I really love them. They are wireless, which makes them perfect for exercising. The volume is great. Very durable product. You really get value for your money.

battery last so much i love these headphones. i bought them in May 2022. i am giving it 4 stars because they are small around the ears and it kinda hurts after a long time of use but that is all. i absolutely love them because the battery last me days and days. i use them often at home and the battery lasts so much i can probably count how many times i charged them because it‚Äôs so little. i bought other headphones because i accidentally broke my JBL, still work but one side is hanging. the new headset i bought for a cheaper price i have to charge it daily because the battery dies so fast. my JBL could never. it‚Äôs worth your money.

These sound very good and super easy to pair. Bought these headphones on sale. Primary use - audio books. Was pleasantly surprised by their sound on everything from jazz to techno to metal: tight bass, good highs. For what I paid, they are great.

A lot of bass, they are everything I wanted. The bass is amazing on these headphones. They are lightweight and adjustable. I love them! I should've got a lot more on Prime Day üò≠ .... Don't sleep on them! Buy them!

Great for sleeping or long car rides. I love using these for sleeping and long car rides. I recently had a very long road trip and they lasted most of it. I've had JBL headphones before, and the ones I had before had a longer battery life and noise cancelling. While these don't have the noise cancelling, they are still very nice.

Excellent customer service. I recently had an issue with my JBL headphones, which I purchased six months ago. There was no sound from the right side on both headsets. I contacted Harman customer service through chat, and they guided me through some troubleshooting steps. When the issue couldn't be resolved, they promptly sent me a return shipping label. Within a week of sending back the defective headphones, I received my replacements. The whole process took just two weeks from start to finish. Harman's customer service was professional, efficient, and communicated well throughout. I am very pleased with the outcome and highly recommend Harman for their excellent customer support. Thank you, Harman, for your professional services and swift resolution!

Nice! It does fit very well, and the sound quality is great, maybe too good. If the volume is all the way up, you can hear it on the outside, so be aware of that in public places (or very close to someone). Other than that, I would recommend. Also, I would recommend registering them with the warranty.

Quality. I purchased my first pair a few years ago. I wanted a new pair in a different color. No issues, I tested them straight out of the box üòé. I wear them at the gym and when I go trail walking üòé‚Ä¶ great quality and affordable!

These headphones are a great value and very comfortable. While, perhaps, not the highest sound quality, these headphones are more than adequate for all the music and audiobooks I listen to. For the price, they are a real deal.

Amazing ‚≠êÔ∏è I got the white JBL's and they work amazingly! The sound bleeds through if you turn your sound up all the way but that is basically the only flaw! The fit is perfect and I would wear them to any place needed! I definitely recommend these headphones!
Great sound! Good quality headphones. I had a very expensive pair of Bose. Once they had broken, I definitely wanted a new headset. Gave these a try and they're great. Recommended purchase.

Decent sound quality for the price. I purchased this during an Amazon promotional discount. Battery life is outstanding. I wish the sound could be a bit louder at max volume, but that‚Äôs just me. Overall a good purchase.

Great headphones for the price. I was looking for new headphones and found this on the flash deals page for cheap. It was nicely boxed and came with a manual. The manual helped with knowing how to skip songs or play the previous song. I've been owning this for almost a year now and it still works with great audio. Not long after receiving and using the headphones, I do and continue to hear low buzzing sounds when I'm not playing anything on the headphones while I have it on, which was very annoying, but I got used to it. The connectivity to my laptop can be wonky sometimes, but I just gotta reset the connection when it doesn't auto-connect. It's pretty comfortable but does hurt my ears after hours of use. I use it for the gym and studying.
Overall not bad, they're overall good headphones, but the sound leaks. They're not very noise-canceling. The mic is decent, the color is what it was supposed to be, and they're pretty durable.

Very good headphones for the price. I was in the market for a headphone I can use for exercise and receive phone calls. Chose this headphone and so far during the second day of use, I have no regrets. I wasn't expecting the highest fidelity; I have that in a more expensive headphone. But the quality of this JBL is good. The phone call was crisp, and the other party had no problems hearing me. It has a nice bass sound in the headphone, which is a surprise. Great for exercise. I didn't have to adjust it at all like my in-ear headphones during my workout. The headphone stays snug on my head, and it's not uncomfortable. Not noise-canceling, but it does take out a lot of the noise. You may have to keep the volume down in public so you can hear when someone is speaking. For the $29 price range, I have more than what I expected.

Headphones affordable and dependable product. Easy to install and use and comfortable. Comes with above average battery life and charges quickly with cable provided. Only downside it has average noise cancellation.

Super customer service! The headset was great until I had a problem with it. JBL customer service was fantastic! Believe the best I've ever experienced. Anything I need, if JBL has it, that's where I'll be buying from now on. Thanks, JBL.

Good buy, great lightweight headphones. Very comfortable on your ears, especially if you wear earrings! Love the color and easy to use. Gifting to a friend now as well. Only downside is they are not soundproof at all; you can definitely hear everything going on around you.

Still working July 2024. The range is limited but the Bluetooth is still working fine for a short distance. Bought a 3m Worktunes headset for $75 that initially had good range but the Bluetooth died at about the 4-month mark. Had to go back to the JBL's, glad I kept them.

Love these! I bought them for the gym and I absolutely love them! I had bad earbuds for everyday use and only use these for about an hour daily, but I haven't had the need to charge them yet! Battery life is great!

Runner approved, I got the headphones for running mostly. My main concern was that they could stay steady on my head while I am running, and they're doing a great job so far. I love the color that I got; it looks lighter in the sun.

Long-lasting battery!! I enjoy how comfortable they are for on-ear headphones! The quality made me afraid to handle but they are not fragile, it's surprisingly durable. I bought it as it was on sale and even without the safe, it is so cheap! Love it üñ§

Good for the price, these are a good option for Bluetooth headphones. They are not nearly as comfortable or quiet as something like a Bose brand, but I know they are not even in the same league as those. They are not the most comfortable either, but they work for me as I didn't want to spend a whole lot of money and just needed something simple to use on my couch to try to block out my tinnitus. If you want something high quality and amazing noise-canceling, I would go with something more expensive.

My son tried to steal them! My teen son likes them better than his expensive Beats! Great quality, comfortable, and good look. The ears are so soft and sound is great! They really are noise-canceling!
Great product and good price. They are comfortable to wear. Quality is good. Easy to use and they are great since they are wireless. Have purchased three sets for family members who loved the gift.
Great gift got them for my mom, easy to set up with her phone. She loves the color and size not to mention it‚Äôs cordless which is perfect to avoid tangling.

Not bad for the price, they do the job for the price. The sound quality is good and they‚Äôre noise-canceling (not as good as higher-priced headphones). The battery life is amazing. My only complaint is I wish the ear muffs were bigger to go around your ear. But again, for the price, they‚Äôre not bad.

Great for the price. I was looking for a change after using AirPods for a while. The headphones are sturdy and the sound has been pretty solid. Haven't tested out the battery life yet, but definitely worth the deal/price! I would recommend.

Portable and durable, obsessed with these. I love my AirPods but sometimes I just want something over the ear. The fact that the quality is so good for the price, unmatched. I‚Äôm not sure about the mic. I haven‚Äôt tried to take calls on this. I keep it in my work bag, so great portability and durability.

Great purchase, we love these. My entire family has a pair. Only issue is I wish the expandable band on top expanded a tad bit more as the guys in the family say they are a little small, but work. Other than that, great quality, great look, great sound. Easy Bluetooth connection.

charger sucks okay so these are so cute and worth it, comes with a charger wire but the wire doesn‚Äôt last long like only for one day and then you have to get a new charger. otherwise the headphones are great!
Great for the price, these are great for working out. However, I'm not sure about the round headpiece; it's a bit painful on my head even with the padding.
Lasts forever, kinda small on my ears but nice looking. The battery is insane on this thing, super long-lasting battery life. I can use it all day on one charge.

My favorite headphones. I absolutely love these headphones. I use them daily. I've been using them since last Thanksgiving. I use them all the time at school. They decently block out everything. And I can't lose them, which is really good.

The Gem Fantastic Value headphones. These are great for the gym because they're durable, provide amazing bass to get you through your workout, and you won't get your premium headphones all sweaty. Keep in mind the ear cups are small and they're not super comfortable, but you will be impressed by the sound quality for the price point. If they're on sale, I would highly recommend getting them.

I love mine, I've had no problem at all with them. I love them, not gonna lie, was kinda skeptical at first. They work phenomenally though. Even with them just over my ears and no music on, I barely hear people.

Best headphones! I love these headphones! I have a small head, so I had to make sure I found something that wouldn't hit my neck. These are great for doing homework, or anything that you need some extra focus for. They aren't noise-canceling, but they do muffle a lot of those smaller noises.

comfortable, lightweight, sound great. I love JBL; they are an amazing affordable option that still sound amazing. I love these; walk with them, run with them, the battery life is really good. I like these a lot.
Just loved I received it a few days ago and have been using it constantly to work out, great audio, beautiful design and the price was affordable. Would buy again.

Ehh, I don‚Äôt love these headphones and I probably wouldn‚Äôt buy them again. The sound quality is fine, but I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre comfortable. I like to listen to music/podcasts while I clean, and these hurt my ears after a while.
Ideal for the gym! They are very comfortable, great sound quality, the audio in the calls is maintained with excellent noise reduction, and their design is ideal for everyday use!
